result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan F Ramos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

- Batterers Intervention program, or a course in Anger Management.
- Parenting classes.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by Agent.
- No Contact with victim or her minor children, but NOT co-habitation, unless approved by Court or Agent.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Clerical error/numerical typo only.  Corrected to show HOC condition time lifted on 11/20/2015 (NOT 11/20/2016).

Defendant Juan F Ramos not in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  The defendant is in absconder status.  The Court lifted the stay on the conditional time 20 DAYS and ordered a commitment to issue.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.

Defendant Juan F Ramos in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1 
The court sentenced the defendant to 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 DAYS time served, with full Huber.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 20 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim or her minor children, but NOT co-habitation, unless approved by court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juan F Ramos in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Sentencing. Attorney Mark Dluzak not in court, in branch 15 unable to appear before branch 23.  Case is adjourned for Sentencing to branch 23.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan F Ramos in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan F Ramos in court with attorney Mark A. Dluzak.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for  Jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.   Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Erin S.

Defendant Juan F Ramos in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Juan F Ramos in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. aa
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Juan F Ramos

Prior: 6825 West Grant Street, West Allis, WI 53219
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
